title: Evidence-Based Basic Life Support (BLS) Standard Training Course for University Students

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A BLS skills acquisition program for non-medical personnel linked to mathematics curricula, with supplementary learning materials accessible via smartphones.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately determine the presence or absence of breathing in adult cardiac arrest patients within 10 seconds.
Learners can perform 2 minutes of continuous accurate chest compressions (depth 5-6 cm, rate 100-120 per minute).
Learners can improve their confidence in BLS performance by over 80% through three or more practice evaluations and feedback cycles.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
